comments.content:
Bring your own database (BYOD)

BYOD allows data from Dynamics 365 to be exported to an Azure SQL Database. This database can then be accessed using T-SQL, making it an ideal choice for third-party analytics tools that require direct SQL access to data. This approach also facilitates combining Dynamics 365 data with other data sources in a single view.
Entity store

The Entity Store is an operational data store optimized for analytical workloads and is designed for use with embedded Power BI reports in Dynamics 365. However, it is not intended for direct T-SQL access by third-party tools.
Power BI

discussion.content: To integrate Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management data with a third-party analytics software solution, the most suitable approach would be Entity store. This feature allows you to create a data store that can be used by external applications, such as your analytics software, to access Dynamics 365 data1. It’s designed to provide a secure and efficient way to share data between Dynamics 365 and other systems.
correct

questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

The company uses a third-party analytics software solution for reporting. The solution requires permissions to ensure T-SQL code can access data.

The company must include Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management data in the analytics software solution to display data in a single view with other data.

You need to identify the correct data analytics approach.

Which solution should you use?

DRAG DROP -
A winery is considering using Dynamics 365 Finance to implement a large-scale ERP application and needs to understand the differences between cloud-based and on-premises deployments.
You need to recommend deployment options for the company.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate deployment types to the correct features. Each deployment type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
DRA is for cloud only, for on- premises Network printing in the on-premises application is supported by the Print and Document Services feature in Microsoft Windows Server 2016
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/install-network-printer-onprem?toc=/dynamics365/commerce/toc.json

Seems correct.
LCS monitoring:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/deployment/on-premises-overview
DRA: 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/install-document-routing-agent?toc=/dynamics365/commerce/toc.json
DRA is meant for cloud. Refer last section: https://www.ascent365.com/blog/microsoft-dynamics-365-finance-operations-deployment-options/

Document routing agent should be on-premises:

https://powerobjects.com/dynamics-365-finance-operations/printing-from-dynamics-365-for-finance-and-operations/

comments.content:
DRA is cloud only: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/install-document-routing-agent

On-premise must use connection to network printers rather than DRA: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/install-network-printer-onprem?toc=/dynamics365/commerce/toc.json

discussion.content: LCS monitoring is used to monitor all environments.

questions.question_text:
You are a solution architect for a company that uses Dynamics 365 finance and operations apps. The company does not have a centralized reporting strategy.

You create a solution design document. The out-of-the-box reports and workspaces do not meet the company’s reporting needs.

The company needs to use available Power BI dashboards to report against Dynamics 365 data.

You need to recommend a data source to use for the Power BI reports.

What should you recommend?

questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance to replace a legacy enterprise resource planning (ERP) system.

A proprietary customer relationship management (CRM) system must be integrated with Dynamics 365 Commerce. The integration must be asynchronous.

You need to use a tool to integrate the CRM system.

Which tool should you recommend?

HOTSPOT
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Microsoft 365 apps to manage sales orders and purchase orders.

A sales manager wants to be able to view sales orders on a monthly basis grouped by sales associate.

The sales manager must be able to do the following:

• Query the data.
• Create pie and bar charts.
• Include or exclude fields.
• Filter data month to month.
• Change data within visuals before monthly meetings.

The solution must not require additional licensing.

You need to identify the correct solution and skill set to implement the solution.

What should you recommend? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Based on this i think its excel and user https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/analytics/create-nextgen-reporting-solutions

Embedded bi requires additional licenses, so no! I think excel is the answer here. You can query data, create pie charts etc.

So for me: Excel and User
Developer is needed for embedded BI
no developer needed ?
correct
